titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John A. Stewman papers, circa 1926-1932 UA.29.02.0101
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Archives Staff; machine-readable finding aid created by: Sherrie Bowser

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-23 15:18:37 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: John A. Stewman served as an engineer with the Duke Construction Company from 1928-1932. The collection includes photographs, drawings, and specs. The material ranges in date from about 1926-1932.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John A. Stewman Papers, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The John A. Stewman papers were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 1989-1994.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions A89-97, A90-84, A94-83 were merged into one collection, described in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: John A. Stewman was an engineer, affiliated with the Duke Construction Company 1928-1932. His uncle, A. Carl Lee was the Chief Engineer of Duke Construction Company and helped oversee the construction of West Campus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection contains materials from John Stewman's time as an engineer for the Duke Construction Company during the building of West Campus. The collection largely includes photographs and negatives of the construction of Duke Chapel from December 10, 1930 to May 2, 1932, taken and identified by John Stewman. Also included are engineering drawings and specifications for buildings on West Campus. The material ranges in date from about 1926-1932.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Note that the photographs are in the Photograph Collection (on-site).
